page.title: 03BLEWBURY VILLAGE
page.content: BLEWBURY'S HISTORY IS LOST IN ANTIQUITY ON THE SOUTHERNMOST PARISH BOUINDARY, HIGH UP ON THE DOWNS,THE ANCIENT RIDGEWAY FORMED PART OF NEOLITHIC MAN'S TRADE ROUTE FROM GRIMES GRAVES IN NORFOLK TO AVEBURY,STONEHENGE AND BEYOND.A LOWLAND DIVERSION FROM THIS ROUTE-THE ICKNIELD WAY-PASSES THROUGH BLEWBURY ITSELF,AS THE HOUSE NAMED "ICKLETON"BEARS WITNESS.THE PRESENT SETTLEMENT GREW UP ALONG THE EDGE OF THE CHALK DOWNS WHERE THE SPRINGS RUN OUT INTO MAANY LITTLE STREAMS.IT WAS DESCRIBED AS "VENERABLAE"IN A SAXON CHARTER OF 944 AD.BY DOMESDAY THE VILLAGE BOASTED FOUR MILLS AND WAS DIVIDED INTO THREE MANORS-GREAT MANOR, NOTTINGHAM FEE,AND THE PREBENDAL MANOR BELONG TO THE CHURCH.AGAIN MANY OF THE PRESENT HOUSE NAMES BEAR WITNESS TO THE VARIOUS MANORS.
